wikipedia_page.main: Sir Roger de Grey,  (18 April 1918 – 14 February 1995) was a British landscape painter. From 1984 to 1993 he served as President of the Royal Academy.

response: Having been elected a full Academician at the Royal Academy in 1979, there were moves to make the 54-year-old sculptor the first female president of the academy, Frink however did not want the post and it went instead to Roger de Grey.

link_mentions.page: List of Old Etonians born in the 20th century
response: *Sir Roger de Grey (1918–1995), visual artist; President of the Royal Academy (1984–1993)
* Sir Roger de Grey (1918–1995), entertainer, President of the Royal Academy
* Roger de Grey, President of the Royal Academy.

link_mentions.page: List of officers of the Royal Academy of Arts

response: She married Sir Roger de Grey in 1942 and was also known by her title of Lady De Grey. They had three children, including the architect Spencer de Grey. Irwin died on 1 August 2009.

link_mentions.page: List of Knights and Dames Commander of the Royal Victorian Order appointed by Elizabeth II (1978–2002)

response: In 1971, when the scheme registered as a charity, a board of trustees administered the programme. Board members at that time included Sir Dennis Proctor, Lawrence Gowing, and Eric Newton, who were later joined by Roger de Grey, former President of the Royal Academy and Lord Croft.
